meanings.definition: A genre of rabbinic literature that includes non-legalistic teachings, stories, and folklore.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed listening to the aggada stories during the holiday celebrations.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi shared an interesting piece of aggada during the sermon.
meanings.sent3: The aggada tale about the wise old man brought smiles to the listeners.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling was like an aggada, weaving magical tales that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The aggada about the talking animals was so vivid, it felt like they were in the room.

meanings.definition: The non-legalistic teachings, stories, and folklore found in rabbinic literature.
meanings.sent1: Reading aggada helps us understand the cultural beliefs of the time.
meanings.sent2: The students were fascinated by the aggada passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The humorous aggada about the mischievous goat always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her words painted a picture of the past, like an aggada come to life.
meanings.sent5: The aggada tales were like windows into ancient traditions, preserving wisdom for future generations.
